intro: Ouratea guildingii, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, white, feathery inflorescences that resemble a mist or cloud, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
